Health & Safety for Licensed Child Care Providers, Module C
Section 2: Building & Physical Premises Safety 

Steps for Adult CPR

Letâ€™s review Adult CPR. If you see someone go down or come across a victim lying unconscious, follow the steps listed here.

  • Safety Gate at Top & Bottom of Stairway  

    Install a secured gate at the top and bottom of each open stairway.

  • Mount Gates to Wall  

    Mount the gates to the wall with hardware to provide stability. It is recommended that safety gates be at least 36 inches tall to discourage adults from stepping over them.

  • Gate Latching Device That Only Adults Can Open With One Motion

    Use gate latching devices that only adults can open. Gates must be able to be opened with one motion and not reduce the minimum opening requirements.

  • Barriers for Elevated Structures

    Install barriers along side any steps, stairs, porches or elevated structures.

  • Handrails for 3 or More Steps

    Install handrails for 3 or more steps or a rise of 24 inches or more.
